Updated November     pm





WICHITA Kan PERIOD AP  Wichita State University says it will cut about . million a year and reallocate funds to help pay for a new School of Business building PERIOD

The decision comes after students voted last month against doubling a campus infrastructure fee all students pay PERIOD It would have raised an estimated . million PERIOD

The Wichita Eagle reports Provost Richard Muma said the cuts from the general use budget will be enough to make an annual payment on a  million bond PERIOD The remaining  million needed for the Frank Barton School of Business building will come from private gifts to the WSU Foundation PERIOD

The university said it will reduce funds for the School of Business the Division of Academic Affairs the Office of Research and Technology Transfer other divisions and Athletics PERIOD



Information from The Wichita Kan. Eagle httpwww.kansas.com
